review_blob: Great malty aroma with a rich brown hue. All malt taste with little to no hop bitterness. Above avarage Octoberfest beer.

A Great brown ale from the Avery Brewing Company.Deep rich chocolate color with a nice light thick head. toasty flavor wiht a nice hoppy late finish. I would drink this everyday, which may lead to drinking problem.
This is just not my style of beer. I cant stand the heavy corlander and orange peel flavor. I will keep trying until I find a Whitbier that I can like.

I was a little disappointed in this beer from Left Hand after devouring the Milk Stout. It had great potential after the pour. Rich amber color with a thin head with a little lacing. The first drink was ok, but the next had an odd lasting taste, and it wasnt the hops.

Draught - Flying Saucer Germantown - Pours a rich deep brown with a creamy tan head. It has a very smooth palate of flavors and is great with bar food. I had to pace myself so I could watch the game before passing out. I would recommend this to any dark beer lover.
Poured a cloudy bright yellow with a small white head. The ginger is a little over powering for my taste buds, but it went great with sushi!

This was a pleasant surprise among all the other typical beers at a local beer tasting. It had a nice rich dark red color with a smooth aroma. Started out with a nice malt flavor with a crisp clean hop finish. I would like to give it another try again.
This beer is just making it into the Memphis Market and tried it at a Fresh Market Beer Tasting. It poured a light color with a very light body. Much better than most American/Europen macros.
Poured a pale yellow with a larger head. Not much flavor or nose. Are there any Hops? I think not!
A great example of a scotish ale. Not quite as smoky as others but a nice deep maltly flavor with a bit of hops finish. A better than avg beer, but not worth the local price.

Like most of the other raters, a little disapointment with the taste/flavor. Great dark color with a storng chocolate aroma. Looking for a little more flavor other than chocolate. Not worth the money to try again.
I nice hoppy beer from the Mendocino Brewing Company. I little light in color and aroma but made up by a lasting citrus hops finish. Good Beer!

This is a another great brew form Dogfish head. It has the rich deep malty flavor of a nice brown ale with a great hoppy finish of an IPA. This beer is just right for a IPA lover looking for something a little different. The only problem is the High Alcohol % :-)

One of the last bottles from Koningshoeven 4 pack in Memphis. Im very disapointed that the local distributor is dropping this brand. This was one of the better Dubbels available here in Memphis. It will truly be missed!
Another great beer fomr Sam Adams! Nice deep amber color and a rich carmely nose. Great with tradtional fall food of sausages and chili. Enjoy!

Was the last beer in a long night of tasting. It had a aroma of ripe sweet fruit (appricots) and a long lasting fizzy head. It was a little on the carbonated side (like Orval) but still another great tasting beer from Unibroue.
Tried along wiht the Blond and other Belgians. The best one of the night. Very Smooth and enjoyable. Could have two or three in one setting.
Had it FedEx to Memphis cold, due to it being un-pasteurized.  Looked and smelled better than it tasted. Could of been off due to the shipping, but still better than other mass produced "Bocks"
Another great Abby Triple. It is sold as Koningsheven Tripel in Memphis and will no longer be avail. A great beer that is very smooth for the Alchol %
Very dry Belgian Ale with a great aroma and appearance. I will have to try again due to the amount of bubbles in the beer. Almost like a dry Champagne.
This was the first one the Grimbergen that I have tried and liked it until I tried the double. Still a great beer with a nice malty sweetness
A great ESB from Bridgeport. They have the West Coast Hops thing down. A great hoppy ESB with a smooth and lasting finish.
This was my first beer from Odells and I really enjoyed it. It had a grat deep amber color and a rich malty flavor. Im looking forward to trying other Odells beers.

Another good beer from Sam Adams. Still not as hoppy as Sierra Nevada or other American Pale Ales but a great refreshing pale ale. It was in the "summer" mix 24 pack and I have bought more after I finished the sample pack.

This was one of the worst beers I have tried in a while. I was really going into tasting with an open mind, but it was bad. Very artifical cherry flavor. In fact I couldnt finish two bottle, so I made homemade Cherry Wheat Ice Cream. The ice cream turned out outstanding and was enjoyed by last months beer club.

One of the only Light Beers I have order while at on the town. It is better than all the other "Light" beers including Amstel light. Still a little weak on the appearance and aroma, but still another nice beer from the Boston Beer Company.

This is a great anytime beer. It has saved me lots of times when eating out at large national chains. I never forced to order it, but it allways a great refreshing choice. Keep the beers coming Mr. Koch!

This is a Perfect Beer. It is hard to compare with other Pilseners due to the refreshing hops bitterness. It pours a golden yellow with a 1" head that sticks around like peanut butter on the roof of a dogs mouth. I will be making a trip to Arkansas to buy more. Please give this beer a try, Im sure you will enjoy it!!

This is the first disappointed from Boulevard Brewing. This was a very light tasting wheat beer that is better on draught, but still lacking flavor. It tasted better when I added some lemon and would be ok on a hot day.
A perfect porter in my mind. Great appearance and aroma with a brown lasting head. One of the better domistic beers and another great beer from Boulevard Brewing. You should try one today!
My first beer from New Holland Brewering and wasnt what I was expecting. It has more citurs hops than other IPA, but still an enjoyable hoppy beer.
One of the best bottle DeScriptions of any beer. This is another great Hoppy beer from Stone. Not as aggressive as I would of thought but still a great crisp full flavored beer.

This is still one of my favorite beers from the Great Lakes brewery. A great lager with just enough hops to give it a great finish. I allways make sure to throw back a few when Im able to get it on draft.

A great example of a Porter. Another great beer form Great Lakes. This is one of the best Drinkable" porters that I have tried. Infsct when Im in Cleveland they are almost allways to Drinkable for me to make my meetings.
Sampled at the Brewery. This is a nice well balance APA. A little hoppy on the finish but still a great Pale Ale. Give it a try!

Im still trying to recover for this over spiced beer. It may be better on a fall day by the fire but in June it was too much. The coriander was the only flavor that I could distinguished in this muddled beer.

One of my favorites from the Shorts Brewing Co. This IPA is heavy on the hops but that is what I like. It is missing the malt to make the flavor a little more richer but it went well with the pizza at the brewery.

On Draft at the Brewery. Had a sample size draft (4 oz.) and that was enough for me. It wasnt a bad beer just a little heavy on the burnt flavors. I thought the coffee would sweeten it up but not much there. Had a great aroma and appearance with a soft creamy feel.
beer_name: Shorts Cup A Joe Coffee Creme Stout

review_blob: On Draft at the Brewery. A little to sweet for my taste. Thought the wheat would add a new dimision but it was lost toasted stout flavor.
Had it from a growlery while golfing in Michigan. It has a sweet malty and carmel tast with just enough hops to make it a smooth beer. It was better closer to room temp.
An amber with a heavy malt finish with a hint of carmel. Better than most mass produced ambers, but still not one of Shorts best brews.

Not one of my favorite beers from Sierra Nevada. I was expecting a little more bitter finish and it was sweeter and malteir than their Pale Ale. It was a great find here in TN but may not buy much more.

Found this at a little deli in Bella Vista Arkansas and it made my day. A great IPA with great Hop flavor followed by a smooth malty finish. This is my fist beer from Avery and Im looking forward to more.

This was the highlight of our IPA beer tasting. It was in a class of its own with a unique taste that is very sweet compared to other traditional IPA beers. I could start the night off with a couple of these but not much more.
Went well with the Spicy Curry but was lacking the hoppy finish that I expect from a great IPA. Still a good beer, but not worth the premium price here in TN.
This is a really bad beer. I tried to use the few I had left over for a marinade, but it turned the meet sour.
It must be the "Kiss" of hops that makes this beer more enjoyable than I thought it was going to be. Great on a hot day in the south and it actual has some flavor.

This was the hands down winner in our Redneck beer blind taste test. It had more flavor than all the other cheap beers, but still not very good. If this is the Champagne" of beers all the other Miller products must be the High Lige of beers.
In our "Blind" taste test of Redneck beers this finished just above Steel Reserve. So this beer sucks but not he worst Ive ever had. It has to be really really cold to even try it.
We tried to make it better by up grading to bottles, but it still sucked. Only good after 12 or more.
